data.question: What is the highest ambient conductivity achieved for the series of solid electrolytes based on LiI and 3-hydroxypropionitrile?
How does the addition of micrometer-sized and nanosized SiO2 particles affect the solid electrolyte?
data.answer: It enhances the conductivity and improves the interfacial contact between electrode/electrolyte.

data.question: Is the compound LiI(3-hydroxypropionitrile)2 a mono-ion transport feature?
What is the light-to-electricity conversion efficiency of a DSSC using LiI(HPN)4/15 wt % nano-SiO2?
Does the addition of silica to the solid electrolyte lead to the formation of large crystallites?
What is the activation energy for the diffusion of iodine in LiI(HPN)2?
Can the addition of 4-tert-butylpyridine to the electrolyte increase the Voc of DSSC?
What is the effect of iodine concentration on the conductivity of the electrolyte?
data.answer: The conductivity decreases with increasing iodine concentration at a concentration range of 0 ≤ I2:I- ≤ 1:10 (molar ratio).

data.question: Is the performance of DSSC improved by adding silica into the electrolyte?
What is the crystal system of LiI(HPN)2?
Does the addition of iodine to the electrolyte always increase the Jsc of DSSC?
What is the role of nanometer-sized silica in the performance of DSSC?
data.answer: It enhances the conversion efficiency by improving interfacial contact and possibly conductivity.

data.question: Is LiI(HPN)2 an I- conductor?
What is the space group of LiI(HPN)2?
Does the addition of nano-SiO2 to the electrolyte decrease its room-temperature conductivity?
What is the effect of adding iodine in advance to the electrolyte on the Jsc of DSSC?
Is the LiI(HPN)4 electrolyte without SiO2 able to fully penetrate into the pores of the TiO2 film?
What is the molecular weight of LiI(HPN)2?
Does the addition of TBP to the electrolyte decrease the Voc of DSSC?
What is the effect of silica particle size on the performance of DSSC?
data.answer: Nanosized silica is more effective in enhancing the performance due to its larger surface area.
